result.execSummary:
The defendant Oliver Clinton PETERS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

No association with any known drug dealers or users.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - CIP.
The defendant has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program as of 08-22-2016.
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

RE:  Deliver Methamphetamine, on 06-30-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of keeper of drug vehicle, bail jumping, 3 counts deliver Methamphetamine within 1000 feet of park/school, 1 count deliver methamphetamine within 1000 feet of park, possess methamphetamine with intent to deliver and disorderly conduct with use of dangerous weapon.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-24-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with any known illicit drug users or distributors.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
